Reviews.Title: Antenna Design Flaw Per Lenovo Tech Support
Reviews.Author: E. Markell
Reviews.Content: You will be VERY unhappy if you buy this machine. I see a few fake paid-for reviews here, but the fact is that the wireless performance is unacceptable. Lenovo tech support told me that the there is an antenna design flaw and there is NO TIME FRAME FOR FIXING THE PROBLEM. On it's website forum, Lenovo lied about fixing the problem on models manufactured after August 2012.

Reviews.Title: Returned the product
Reviews.Author: Mitra
Reviews.Content: The wifi card in the laptop was not functional. This is an issue with all U310 models and no fix was available.

Reviews.Title: Complete boot failure
Reviews.Author: R A Altmann
Reviews.Content: Nice machine, lasted less than a week and then failed totally. Would not boot. No replacement available at the same price

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for Mac OS X
Reviews.Author: Trevyn Langsford
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop a couple months ago, and immediately got rid of the preinstalled Windows operating system. I was using Linux Mint for a while, and everything worked out great. The trackpad took a little tinkering, but that's because Linux doesn't have the best support for buttonless trackpads yet. After a couple months of use, I decided to install Mac OS X on it. This is not a process that should be attempted by users with little computer knowledge. Much time was spent in a command line environment, and it took me a whole weekend to configure properly. The result is a Hackbook Pro with almost everything working. I get around 5 hours of battery out of it, and everything functions correctly except the wireless card. I'll replace the wireless card with a compatible model later, so there should be no issues. Since this laptop has an SSD, I've installed the operating system on it and used the HDD for data storage. With this configuration, the laptop feels blazingly fast and it goes from cold boot to having Safari open in less than 10 seconds. The keyboard is a little lackluster, but I paid less than $400 for mine, so I'm not going to complain at all. The screen doesn't get as bright as I'd like it to, and the color reproduction isn't accurate, especially at wide viewing angles. I would have preferred to see a higher resolution display, but since I use it hooked up to and HDMI monitor, it doesn't bother me too much.

Reviews.Title: cheap and awesome
Reviews.Author: marie
Reviews.Content: For the price it was right. I love my laptop. It is perfect for what I need which is something with Windows  7 that I can use to type and surf the web. It is compact, sturdy and attractive. I would buy again :)

Reviews.Title: Very Fast with a Touchy trackpad
Reviews.Author: David Dudley II
Reviews.Content: So this computer has all the specs you could need, SSD for Windows to run in, USB 3.0 for fast transfers, super light and thin.  Only issue is that the trackpad seems very touchy, I wish there was a way to separate the buttons from the pad but so far I have not figured it out.  Otherwise I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Working fine after some early troubles.
Reviews.Author: Michael McCann
Reviews.Content: The computer arrived in pretty good condition, with one piece of the case that needed snapping back into place. After setting up Windows and removing some bloatware, Windows Update started giving errors. I used the recovery app that comes on the computer to return to factory settings and everything worked fine the second time around.I have not had any issues with the wifi as some others have.

Reviews.Title: The WiFi problems are true. Lenovo needs to recall these ultrabooks.
Reviews.Author: Christine Marie Watkins
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the poor ratings about the WiFi I got this laptop because of my great experiences with Lenovo Thinkpads. Unfortunately the reviews are true. The WiFi is awful. Almost useless. It was basically dead in the water when more than 15ft away from the base. I took this laptop to school and used it where I had used my 7 year old HP laptop with no reception issues and the Lenovo U310 had no service. Even when the laptop showed reception bars there was no service. Its truly a shame. Its a beautiful laptop. The keyboard is awesome. The trackpad was great for a trackpad.Lenovo has a big problem here. There are countless forums of people dealing with this issue and no real solutions. Avoid this ultrabook!

Reviews.Title: Looks great, performs horribly.
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: This laptop is really nice looking, and at first, it worked great. I was really happy with my purchase for...oh, the first 2 months or so. But things rapidly went downhill from there. First, the wifi refused to connect. Constantly. And when it did connect, it went out. This problem worsened to the point where i could barely use the wifi. Then, it started crashing randomly. This was rare at first but eventually grew to happen about every 10 minutes. The final nail in the coffin was when it stopped accepting a charge. I finally brought it back, used my warranty and picked up a different laptop. It lasted me for three months. What a useless product.

Reviews.Title: Not without its problems
Reviews.Author: goblin boots
Reviews.Content: As many others have said, this thing has wifi issues. For me, wifi is only wonky when I'm running on battery, and then only occasionally. The trackpad is a bit finicky. The os is installed on the (slow) hard drive, and NOT on the SSD. No matter, I instantly wiped both drives and installed xubuntu 12.10 when I got this.If you're going to run linux on this machine:- You must disable IRST (Intel Rapid Storage Technology).- Disable EFI booting.- Seems like there is an SDL bug with recent Ubuntu and Mint versions that cause the trackpad to be completely unusable when running fullscreen SDL apps. There's a workaround, but it's a pain in the butt.I would recommend against KDE at the moment, as the Intel HD 4000 graphics do not seem to play well with KWin from my experience. Lots of strange artifacts and screen tearing.I also tested Linux Mint 14 Cinnamon, which seemed to work fine.Booting up, with linux installed on the SSD, is ridiculously fast, as is waking from suspend. The machine does stay cool and quiet most of the time.Oddly, booting from the USB 3.0 ports seems to work only if you're using a USB 2.0 device. I'm guessing this is probably because I've disabled EFI booting, but who knows.I paid a premium to buy this machine over the newer revisions with i5 or even i7 CPUs to ensure I got a Windows 7 machine. Who knows what kind of crazy hoops I'd have to jump through to disable the SecureBoot nonsense if I'd gone for the newer Windows 8 models.This is my first non-ThinkPad Lenovo machine. I'm not exactly disappointed with this laptop, but I'd almost certainly spring for an actual ThinkPad next time.

Reviews.Title: awesome machine
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Coppola
Reviews.Content: Boots very quickly, even after three months of use. Great value, and looks very smart to rival the Apple equivalent.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Computer--fast and reliable thus far
Reviews.Author: WeBDucks "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this computer for three weeks so it is a little early to place a definitive review on line, BUT I can say to date that it is fast,easy to use and very reliable.  It is also lightweight and easy to pack for travel.  The only issue I have had appears to be one with Windows and likely has nothing to do with the computer--that is a problem with configuring Windows Updates.  I hope to have that resolved soon.

Reviews.Title: Nice and light ... good power ... good screen ... does it all
Reviews.Author: S. Greenblatt
Reviews.Content: I've been happy with this computer since I got it.  It's not filled with bloatware and it does what they say it should do.  Not too much more to write.  It's a good ultrabook.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Laptop
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a reviewAn indication of how bad this product isReceived with faulty track-pad and wirelessStay away

Reviews.Title: lenovo Ultabook
Reviews.Author: chuckT
Reviews.Content: the Lenovo ULTRABOOK is great for home or business. it is fast and lightweight. has all the features that I needed. i recomend this for anyone who does a lot of traveling. i recomend using a mouse with this computer to make it a bit easier to work on the small screen.
